perturbation.original_text: Manufacturer shall manufacture and supply each Product (including disposing of all Waste and other materials) in accordance with all applicable Specifications, applicable Laws, requirements under the applicable Quality Agreement, and this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Manufacturer should endeavor to manufacture and supply each Product (including disposing of all Waste and other materials) in general accordance with applicable Specifications, applicable Laws, the Quality Agreement, and this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text creates a strict obligation to manufacture and supply products in accordance with all applicable laws. By changing 'shall manufacture' to 'should endeavor to manufacture' and including terms like 'general accordance', the obligation becomes ambiguous and less enforceable. The phrase 'general accordance' is vague and allows for subjective interpretation, weakening the requirement for strict compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 21 CFR Part 210 and 211 - Current Good Manufacturing Practice regulations, which mandates strict adherence to manufacturing standards.

perturbation.original_text: Manufacturer shall reasonably cooperate with Customer in responding to all requests for information from, and in making all legally required filings with, Governmental Authorities in the Territory having jurisdiction to make such requests or require such filings. Manufacturer shall: (a) obtain and comply with all licenses, consents and permits required under applicable Laws in the Territory (and Manufacturer shall provide Customer with a copy of all such licenses, consents and permits that are material upon Customer's reasonable request); and (b) comply with all applicable Laws in the Territory with respect to its manufacturing and packaging processes, the Facility or otherwise, to permit the performance of its obligations hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: Manufacturer should use reasonable efforts to cooperate with Customer in responding to requests for information from Governmental Authorities. Manufacturer might obtain licenses and permits if deemed necessary and will try to comply with applicable laws to permit the performance of its obligations hereunder. The specifics of such compliance will be determined on a case-by-case basis.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires the manufacturer to obtain licenses, permits and comply with all applicable laws. The modified text weakens this obligation by using terms like 'should use reasonable efforts', 'might obtain licenses', and 'will try to comply', making the obligation less stringent. The phrase 'The specifics of such compliance will be determined on a case-by-case basis' introduces further ambiguity, reducing the accountability for regulatory compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 21 U.S. Code ยง 351 - Adulterated drugs and devices, which prohibits manufacturing drugs or devices without complying with all applicable legal requirements.

perturbation.original_text: Manufacturer shall not release any Product for Delivery to Customer that does not conform to the covenants set forth in Section 5.2(e) (such non-conforming Product, "Non-Complying Product"), without the prior written approval of Customer. Manufacturer shall quarantine all such Non-Complying Products and shall promptly submit to Customer a report detailing the nature of such non-compliance and Manufacturer's recommended disposition, including the investigation and testing done. Manufacturer shall also provide any additional information regarding such Non-Complying Product as may reasonably be requested by Customer.
perturbation.changed_text: Manufacturer may, at its discretion, release Product for Delivery to Customer that does not strictly conform to the covenants in Section 5.2(e), provided the Manufacturer documents that it made commercially reasonable efforts to conform to such standard. Manufacturer should attempt to quarantine such Products when it is feasible and may provide a report if such action is deemed prudent. Manufacturer will make reasonable attempts to provide information requested by Customer.
perturbation.explanation: By replacing 'shall not release' with 'may, at its discretion, release', and weakening 'shall quarantine' to 'should attempt to quarantine when it is feasible', the obligation to prevent the delivery of non-complying product is significantly weakened. The addition of 'commercially reasonable efforts' introduces a subjective criterion that could allow the manufacturer to justify releasing non-compliant product. The term 'prudent' introduces another ambiguous aspect that is opened to interpretation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 21 U.S. Code ยง 355 - New drugs, which requires that new drugs are proven to be safe and effective before they are released to market.
